alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Dewey; Garfield; Woods (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 26 at 8:37PM CST until February 26 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN KINGFISHER...SOUTHEASTERN WOODS...ALFALFA...NORTHERN BLAINE...WESTERN GRANT...EAST CENTRAL DEWEY...WESTERN GARFIELD AND EASTERN MAJOR COUNTIES... At 837 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Amorita to 5 miles southeast of Cherokee to 4 miles southeast of Eagle City, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Enid, Fairview, Cherokee, Helena, Waukomis, Okeene, Canton, Lahoma, Ringwood, Drummond, Carmen, Wakita, Cleo Springs, Longdale, Goltry, Ames, Meno, Jet, Aline and Nash. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
